greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of partitions of n having exactly k parts equal to 2 (n>=0, 0<=k<=floor(n/2)).
comment: Row sums are the partition numbers (A000041).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for the first 100 rows, flattened
formula: T(n, floor(n/2))=1 (follows at once from the g.f.).
maple: with(combinat): T:=proc(n,k) if k=floor(n/2) then 1 elif k<=(n-2)/2 then numbpart(n-2*k)-numbpart(n-2*k-2) fi end: for n from 0 to 18 do seq(T(n,k),k=0..n) od; # yields sequence in triangular form
mathematica: nn = 20; p = Product[1/(1 - x^i), {i, 3, nn}]; f[list_] := Select[list, # > 0 &]; Map[f, CoefficientList[Series[p /(1 - x)/(1 - y x^2), {x, 0, nn}], {x, y}]] // Flatten  (* _Geoffrey Critzer_, Jan 22 2012 *)
results.author: _Emeric Deutsch_, Feb 18 2006
ext: Keyword tabl changed to tabf by _Michel Marcus_, Apr 09 2013
